alert.note: Alert for Banner; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 12:49AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Scotts Bluff, northwestern Banner and south central Sioux Counties through 1215 AM MDT... At 1149 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morrill, or 13 miles northwest of Scottsbluff, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Morrill, Minatare, Lyman, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Stegall, Wildcat Hills Campground, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Hubbard Hill, Scottsbluff Airport, Lake Alice, Melbeta and Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
